title: Executive Order 8795-Modifying Executive Order of December 12, 1917, Creating Power Site Reserve No. 661
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by the act of June 25, 1910, c. 421, 36 Stat. 847, as amended by the act of August 24, 1912, c. 369, 37 Stat. 497, it is ordered that the Executive order of December 12, 1917, creating Power Site Reserve No. 661, be, and it is hereby, modified to the extent necessary to permit the County of Lane, Oregon, to construct a road over lot 5, sec. 35, T. 16 S., R. 2 E., Willamette meridian, Oregon, as shown on a map on file in the General Land Office, Department of the Interior, and bearing the title
COUNTY ROAD LOCATIONIN SECTION 35, T 16 S. R. 2 E. W. M.LANE COUNTY, OREGON

on condition that the use of the road or any part of it shall be discontinued without liability or expense to the United States or its licensees when found by the Secretary of the Interior to be in conflict with project works authorized by the United States.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8795-Modifying Executive Order of December 12, 1917, Creating Power Site Reserve No. 661 Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/368233
